attributes.action: Add recycling to the curriculum. Even if it's 1 day a year - possibly a visit.
attributes.background:
Incorrect recycling costs taxes.
I received a leaflet about what can be recycled in my area. It also explained the process which interested me. I think more education is needed.

Children are the future this will help them recycle correctly or even improve the system.
attributes.additional_details:
School is where we learn life skills, preparing us for adulthood. Recycling is currently not as efficient as it could be because the public are not fully educated. Personally I've attended beach cleans, researched where to recycle electronics / printer parts / clothes... It is all difficult to follow.

If schools had one lesson a year dedicated to recycling.
Maybe an expert from the industry could visit, they would learn the common mistakes of recyclers. Some would see it as a career path.

attributes.action: Create charter & new body for complaints about Local Authority Chief Executives
attributes.background: We need a new tribunal that would carry out hearings against Chief Executives in local authorities/councils who misuse their powers/cover up complaints/are awarded excessive salaries. The new body should recommend that individuals be prosecuted/sacked & recommend ways to reform the local authority.
attributes.additional_details: This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call Chief Executives/witnesses to appear, summon documents & records. Most importantly, it must include the complainants to ensure it has the confidence of the public. Currently those in our public services are able to misuse public money to defend themselves by using legal departments to cover up whilst the public face cutbacks to services. The public should have the right to challenge

attributes.action: Require local councils to issue parking charges by recorded delivery
attributes.background: Sending PCNs by 2nd class postage does not guarantee delivery to home addresses and as a result quite often representation or appeal of the contravention is missed. Recorded delivery would eliminate this issue and the cost should be added to the original PCN meaning no cost to the council.
attributes.additional_details: There are many instances on multiple forums of people experiencing this exact issue. It’s unfair to not have received the original letter on time and as a result the fine being multiplied and even in some cases warrants issued to bailiffs. I personally didn't receive the first PCN letter and the fine was £65, now the fine is £195 as a result of not receiving the 2nd class letter sent out by the local council. Is this fair or just a money making loop hole by the councils.

attributes.action: Improve the number and quality of care homes
attributes.background: Many children in care experience multiple placements, in some cases going to 8 or more different care homes. This is because care homes either shut down or get too full, so a large number of children in care have nowhere to go and end up on the streets, increasing child poverty numbers.

attributes.action: Make the history of British colonialism part of high school curriculum.
attributes.background: Too many people, especially the new generation do not know anything about the British empire or the colonies which helped make Britain great. Some people are also oblivious to the pain and suffering the Empire caused as well as all the positive impacts it had to less affluent countries.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is a huge multicultural society. Our society, whatever their background need to be taught where they came from and how they got to the positions they are in now. It’s a too wider misconception that there has just been constant mass migrations for no apparent reason. I believe if the history of the British Empire were taught then a lot of what is happening in the present would be sympathised with and more could be done to resolve issues by all ethnicities.

attributes.action: Full Public Investigation into all Unresolved Complaints of NHS Medical Errors
attributes.background: For over 40 yrs, the system has failed to protect patients who have suffered medical accidents/errors under the NHS. A toxic culture has prevailed within the NHS of closing ranks to cover up complaints. We need a new body to investigate all unresolved complaints and the misuse of powers/public money
attributes.additional_details: Given the gravity of scale of covering up by the NHS & lack of action taken by complaint bodies & those in Government, this new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate all complaints. In order to avoid harm to patients the government need to carry out an investigation across the UK to identify the systemic failure across the NHS & avoid future harm to patients. It must include victims left with ongoing health problems/disabilities & families who have lost a loved one since 1980

attributes.action: Tax breaks for public houses that ONLY serve beverages manufactured in the UK.
attributes.background: To aid against the loss of public houses across the UK, many of which are central to a community. Also providing a boost to UK brewers/manufacturing. And creating more jobs in this sector.

attributes.action: Allow store loyalty card schemes to award points on the purchase of baby formula
attributes.background:
The law as it stands prohibits stores from issuing loyalty card points on the sale of baby milk formula. Parents are barred from amassing points to make savings.

This is unfair to parents who don't always have a choice in using formula. Also to parents exercising their right to choose not to.
attributes.additional_details:
The Infant Formula and Follow-on Formula (England) Regulations 2007 (section 23) prohibits marketing of baby formula. Loyalty card schemes are being caught up in this, barring parents from accruing points and making savings. 

The purchase is being made regardless, without promotional inducement. The collection of points by parents cannot be called marketing.

The legislation can be found here

https://www.legislation.gov.uk/uksi/2007/3521/regulation/23/made

attributes.action: Ban Govt ministers of places where homosexuality is illegal owning UK companies
attributes.background: In many countries, homosexuality is still considered a crime. This is in direct contrast to the UK, where same-sex sexual activity has been legal since 1967. Government Ministers in countries where homosexuality is still illegal should be banned from owning UK based companies.
attributes.additional_details: Mansour bin Zayed Al Nahyan is currently the Deputy Prime Minister of the United Arab Emirates, where same-sex sexual activity is illegal. He also owns City Football Group, which Manchester City FC is part of. Football is the national sport of the UK, yet the owner of the Premier League champions is Deputy Prime Minister of a country where homosexuality is illegal. If LGBT equality is to be achieved, Government Ministers from these countries cannot be permitted to own UK-based companies.

attributes.action: Reform the police complaints system
attributes.background: For over 50 years, the system has failed to protect Black/Asian people from feeling targeted and racially profiled by the police. We need a new body to investigate police misuse of powers, recommend that individual officers be prosecuted or sacked and recommend ways to reform the police.
attributes.additional_details:
This new body should have all the powers necessary to investigate complaints itself, including being able to call witnesses and summon documents and records. Most importantly, it must include representatives of victims of police misconduct to ensure it has the confidence of every individual in society. People should be protected regardless of colour or background.
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/207561
https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/166709

attributes.action: Stop the land asset stripping of the NHS recommended in the Naylor report.
attributes.background: Forcing NHS trusts to sell off their valuable land to cover basic costs the government won't adequately is wrong. We don't need a private profit health service system as with the US. It is unacceptable.

attributes.action: Legalise plural marriage.
attributes.background: The people will be free to decide for themselves how many people they can marry.
attributes.additional_details: The government has no reason to involve itself in the love life of its citizens.

attributes.action: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour
attributes.background: Cap car parking charges in hospitals to £1.00 per hour.  When you attend a hospital for treatment or to visit someone then you are probably under stress, so finding extra money to pay for car parking (especially the high charges some hospitals charge) is just adding to the stress your under.
attributes.additional_details: I suspect that some people are choosing to go without food etc just to pay for car parking charges which can mount up if  you are there for some hours and have to visit on several occassions.  The government intervened in the gambling laws they could intervene in this. These charges effect the most vunerable in our society, the sick, low paid, the ones that can't afford to go private.

attributes.action: Condemn killings by the Indian government
attributes.background: On 23rd May 2018, Indian and local Tamil Nadu government forces killed 13 unarmed civilians protesting against environmental disaster created by Sterlite copper in Tuticorin, TN owned by Vedanta resources plc.
attributes.additional_details: The UK Government must condemn this human rights violation and urge the India Government to protect human rights, including people’s right to protest.

attributes.action: Launch an awareness campaign for the causes and symptoms of skin cancer
attributes.background: Last year I had Melanoma and there was little awareness out there, there is more than 1 type of skin cancer. I feel that there is little awareness out there about them and about damage the sun/sun beds can do. There needs to be more campaigns to help prevent it.

attributes.action: Ban the selling and open displaying of Golliwog dolls in UK stores.
attributes.background: Golliwog dolls depict a racially insulting charactater of black people. This is no longer acceptable. Sign the petition and let the goverment know, how the UK really feels about the legal selling and displaying of Golliwog dolls.
attributes.additional_details:
The Golliwog character has long been used in childrens literature, to denigrate black people. The use of the racial word "wog" originates from this ignorant depiction of black people.

It's time for all people to make clear that the selling of these racially provocative dolls, needs to stop.

The displaying of such dolls on store front windows, has to stop.

Share and sign this petition.

attributes.action: Examine Greybull's actions in respect of insolvency of Monarch Airline/Holidays.
attributes.background: Monarch ceased trading on Monday 2 October 2017, leaving 2,000 employees without jobs and 860,000 passengers without flights. This is Greybull’s third venture that has failed and the largest failure in British aviation history.
attributes.additional_details: We question the entire involvement of Greybull Capital in respect of Monarch. From reports it would appear that both prior and post insolvency the UK Government have pumped millions of pounds into Greybull Capital and although Greybull state they have lost out in excess of £100 million it is reported that Monarch had £48 million in the bank and aircraft take off and landing slots will be worth at least £60 million to Greybull. These figures alone equate to greater than £100 million.

attributes.action: Ban plastic toothbrushes and replace with Eco/environmental friendly ones
attributes.background: The biggest causes of pollution are factories, the burning of fossil fuels and of course plastics but the list of causes continues, we need to stop using plastic so much and replace it with environmental/Eco friendly products.
attributes.additional_details: With the removal of plastic toothbrushes from our country will NOT become an issue, plastic can easily be replaced with wooden brushes that can be recycled, or even better options such as Eco-friendly bags.Plastic causes damage to the environment; animals are suffering from the constant dumping of plastic, another is that sewage-system gets clogged the plastic form clumps with other waste and blocks water running, beautiful landscapes and habitats are destroyed. It is an open and shut case.

attributes.action: Have a referendum allowing all the UK a vote on Scotland’s Independence.
attributes.background: In 2014 Scotland had an independence vote on whether to remain in the UK or become an independent country.  The rest of the UK did not get to vote on if we wanted Scotland to remain.  Allow all UK citizens, including the Scottish to debate and vote on Scotland’s continued membership in the UK.

attributes.action: Change Planning Laws on Fences to require a 300mm Hole on each side for Wildlife
attributes.background: Today most New Houses have FULLY enclosed rear gardens with high fences down to the ground, seeing our Wildlife is in Decline it makes sense to help them out with these Holes so they can Roam around as they should, Humans have and keep taking away their Habitat, Hedgehogs for one do a lot of good.
attributes.additional_details:
Concrete Gravel Boards need to have one Manufactured with a Hole, wooden fences need the same when sat on the ground, Humans must try to Protect Wildlife for future Generations or we are Selfish.
 
Please Support this as our Wildlife would Appreciate it.

attributes.action: Remove the 16-25 railcard minimum fare on trains before 10am
attributes.background: National Rail has a ban on using railcard discounts before 10 am due to the minimum train fare restriction between 4:30 am and 10 am of £12 which students and workers can't afford to pay everyday.

attributes.action: British Sign Language Should be taught in Primary and Secondary schools in UK.
attributes.background: Children who are deaf should have the choice of which school they want to go to, but the problem with this is integrating with other children cause BSL (British Sign Language) is not part of the National Curriculum.
attributes.additional_details:
Approximately 1 in every 1000 children is born with a severe or profound hearing loss. 90% of all deaf children are born to hearing parents. Approximately 50,000 deaf people in the UK use British Sign Language (BSL) as their first or preferred language.

Deaf children in the UK aged 0 to 15 is at 23000 so it shows that BSL should be in the National Curriculum so our children can integrate with the deaf community and BSL would be a language they would use lots off time in there life.

attributes.action: UK to sign the United Nations Convention on Migrants’ Rights
attributes.background:
The International Convention on the Protection of the Rights
of All Migrant Workers and Members of Their Families is a United Nations multilateral treaty governing the protection of migrant workers and families. It has still not been signed by the UK despite being adopted by General Assembly 1990.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.ohchr.org/en/professionalinterest/pages/cmw.aspx

attributes.action: Make online retailers disclose the courier company that they use on website
attributes.background: With a varying degree of service provided by differing courier companies and not knowing which company will be (or not) delivering your goods, it should be compulsory for all online retailers to disclose which company they are using, prior to checkout on the website.
attributes.additional_details: Knowing which courier company has been engaged stops the lottery of will they or won't they deliver. In rural areas we know which companies are reliable and which ones don't bother at all, however, when we order we are then subject to the lottery of will goods turn up or not. This will ensure that we can have an informed choice as to whether to proceed with the purchase or not before committing to it.

attributes.action: Lower the age at which men can claim the state pension.
attributes.background: In an age of total equality, surely it is only fair and right that men and women enjoy a similar amount of time in retirement. As life expectancy for men is, on average, 4 years shorter than for women, surely they (men) should be able to claim their state pension 4 years earlier.

attributes.action: Make the date of leaving the eu our uk independance day
attributes.background: When we leave the eu it will be a great part of our uk history. So calling it our independance day could be celibrated by future generations.

attributes.action: Require all Staffordshire bull terriers to be muzzled & leashed when in public.
attributes.background: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers.
attributes.additional_details: Legislation is required to combat attacks by Staffordshire bull terriers. Dog chipping has not resulted in any reduction in dangerous dog attacks as claimed by politicians prior to the introduction of that legislation.

attributes.action: Fund overnight hostels for homeless people in each town and city
attributes.background: I wish for this to happen because homeless people are not treated fairly in today’s society and wish to show people that everyone is equal.
attributes.additional_details: If people are living on the streets then it could cause more health condition and cost more money for the NHS which is already struggling as quite clearly proven

attributes.action: Remove disability exemptions for the armed forces from the 2010 Equality Act
attributes.background: I was recently rejected by the Lancaster UOTC because of my Autism even though during their selection day in Liverpool I passed all their selection tests and completed all the required paperwork. They rejected me because I declared that I had a medical condition (Autism)
attributes.additional_details:
They rejected me because I declared on one of the medical forms that I have a medical condition (Autism). I had to declare it as it was a legal requirement. 
 
https://apply.army.mod.uk/how-to-join/can-i-join/medical
 
Autism is not included, yet on other British Army medical forms, one must disclose their Autism, and in turn they can be discriminated against because of this due to the exemption from parts of the Equality Act 2010.

attributes.action: Raise the Level of Tax free Allowance to £24'000
attributes.background: People should start paying income tax when they earn above the average national living wage.  The tax free allowance currently stands at £11'850 and from that point onwards income tax is applied.  I believe this should be increased to £24'000 to increase individual and families disposable income.
attributes.additional_details:
Putting cash in the pockets for the majority of the population should be an immediate priority for the government during this time of austerity.  This gesture would help those on lower incomes to meet the increasing costs of food & housing whilst also boosting the economy as people would have more disposable income to spend how they need.

I understand people want to contribute the society they live in and they will continue to be able to do so through our current rates of VAT on purchases.

attributes.action: Reduce the age of buying beer and alco-pops 5% and under, wine under 13% to 16
attributes.background: We would like the legal age of purchasing certain alcoholic beverages to the age of 16. By reducing the purchasing of beer and wine to 16 there will be less consumption of hard spirits as well as the use of counterfeit identification. This will promote a safer way for children to experiment.
attributes.additional_details: This theory is modelled on many European countries laws; Belgium, Germany and Spain. In 2016, 7,327 people died from alcohol related deaths of which many were caused by excessive drinking of spirits. The countries current legislation promotes the use of spirits for underage teenagers to become intoxicated. So by legalising a safer alternative to consume alcohol, which is an inevitability, there will be a decrease in alcohol related medical conditions in underage teenagers.

attributes.action: Include education on domestic abuse to the national curriculum.
attributes.background: I am a survivor of domestic abuse and violence which resulted in me losing my children. I think all children should be educated about domestic abuse so that they can identify it and so that they know it’s not acceptable.
attributes.additional_details: My experiences led me to write my experiences down and I’m waiting for a book to emerge be published. I’ve also set up a Facebook page called Parent Alienation Syndrome to help others in my situation.

attributes.action: Make it compulsory for all adults working with children to be first aid trained.
attributes.background: Not all members of preschool/school staff are first aid trained only a select few. Trained adults can be absent from work or out on a course or a school trip and leave the school without a first aider. This is a particular issue at lunchtimes in school when the adult ratio to children is often low.
attributes.additional_details: Children can have many complex medical needs/ food allergies. As well as everyday trips and bumps in the playground. Unfortunately acciends have been reported in the news and a recent case of a boy choking at lunchtime. All staff should be trained to avoid being left without a first aider for our children when they need one. All adults working with children should know what to do.

attributes.action: make it a legal requirement to inform UK phone callers the cost of phone calls
attributes.background: The cost of phone calls from a mobile phone or landline should be regulated so that prior to connection a prerecorded message should make the charge per minute clear to the caller and all Utility companies and Charities for the low paid and vulnerable should have available freephone contact numbers
attributes.additional_details: Offcom really need to put their house in order they have consistently failed to inform the public about how much money they are paying for phone calls especially on 'pay as you go'. Some phone numbers in the UK which are regularly used by those on low incomes and those on benefits are being charged at exorbitant rates which they can ill afford. Im sue many of these people end up not making  calls because of the cost and end up being penalised for not informing a company or government department

attributes.action: Set up a single tribunal service for all public services complaints/ grievances.
attributes.background: Call on the government to create a fair free tribunal body and procedure to hear complaints/grievances/appeals relating to failure, mistakes or misuse of power by those in all public services who conceal their wrongdoing.
attributes.additional_details:
The impact to people affected is simply being normalised and accepted as the way things are.

The public must have a right to a fair tribunal service & charter which allows their concerns to be heard when they have suffered failure/mistakes & gives the tribunal more powers to compel witnesses/public officers to testify. The public’s rights matter & they must be entitled to free access to justice & due process in disputes before an impartial judge as those in public office can use public money to conceal failure/mistakes & those affected have no voice & most cannot access legal assistance.

attributes.action: Income Tax changes to be more diverse either individual or per house hold
attributes.background: Currently income tax works on an individual basis, therefore if a household has two workers at 35k they both pay 20% tax each, however in a family with children only one adult works they are penalised after 46k,
attributes.additional_details:
Council tax and other taxes work on the basis of per house hold so why not for Income Tax, changing this to a per household rate allowing partners to absorb/ utilise the tax allowance prior to the increase to 40% and/or 50%. 

Example could be: Adult 1 salary 20k, Adult 2 salary 60k tax would only increase to 40% once 80k mark has hit, this would aide families where only one parent is working and/ or coupled adults living under a single roof

attributes.action: Fund a National Holodomor Memorial
attributes.background: The Holodomor was a famine that occurred in the years 1932-33 in what is now Ukraine. It is recognised as genocide or as a criminal act of the Stalinist Regime by 22 countries. While the undersigned support the government's decision not to join these countries, we believe it deserves recognition.
attributes.additional_details: The government has chosen (quite rightly) to construct a memorial to the Holocaust. We believe that the Holodomor was horrific enough to merit this same recognition. A memorial to those who died in the Holodomor (some 7.5 million people, according to some estimates) would serve as a message that the UK truly rejects this kind of evil in whatever form it takes, whether blatant or less conspicuous and whether from the left or the right of the political spectrum.

attributes.action: Bring in minimum standards for certain camping equipment sold in the UK.
attributes.background: There is a huge amount of camping equipment abandoned at festivals every year which is bad for the environment. Much of the equipment is of a poor standard and inadequate for the British summer leading to many people getting cold and wet to the extent that they need medical help.
attributes.additional_details:
Minimum standards should be -
Tents must have an inner and outer skin and a minimum Hydrostatic Head rating of 3000. (Small play tents can be exempt.)
Any sleeping bag rated as suitable only for temperatures over 5 degrees centigrade should be clearly labelled "UK Indoors Only".
Roll mats must have a minimum thickness when compressed. 
All folding chairs and stools must have their maximum weight clearly displayed in kilogrammes and stones and pounds, in large letters on the sales label.

attributes.action: Require councils to provide lollypop men and women
attributes.background: Stop any councils in England from using the funds for road crossing supervisors (Lollypop men and Women) to save money. The UK Government should provide additional funding for councils if necessary.
attributes.additional_details: Please check out https://www.derbytelegraph.co.uk/burton/school-crossing-patrol-staffordshire-cuts-1997550 and ITV central news 13/9/18

attributes.action: BAN letting TWO persons ride on a moped together
attributes.background: Whist in London taking pictures of Shard near Tower of London. Moped with two passengers mounted pavement, came from behind and as passed across the front of my nephew the back seat passenger grabbed the tripod i/c camera and carried on up the road weaving in and out dangerously with traffic.
attributes.additional_details: More than 60 crimes using mopeds or motorbikes were carried out every day in London alone on average over the past year - a 50% increase on the previous 12 months.

attributes.action: Abandon government plans to include calories on all restaurant menus
attributes.background: The government’s plan to list calories on all restaurant menus not only will remove the joy of eating out at restaurants, but also is a cruel hinderance to those recovering from eating disorders. We need a more nuanced way to define what is “healthy” than obsessively listing and tracking calories.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.telegraph.co.uk/politics/2018/09/04/plans-force-restaurants-cafes-takeaways-display-calorie-counts/

attributes.action: all children to attend the school nearest to their home address
attributes.background: Remove parental choice of school - You only have to travel in commuter time in school holidays vs other dates to know how much congestion and pollution,and  along with wasted man hours and traffic collisions are caused by children having to commute to their parents' chosen schools.
attributes.additional_details:
What a waste of time and valuable growing up, as well as the safety risks.

Parents would be better off spending their time energy and money on helping to improve their local school rather than selfishly encouraging their children to attend 'better' ones further away.

attributes.action: Make good facial growth a strategic health priority.
attributes.background: We ask parliament to make good facial growth a strategic health priority, through an early years education programme and through supporting Public Health England to make research, analysis and treatment policy in this area part of their next strategic plan.
attributes.additional_details: More information can be found on www.preventcrookedteeth.com.

attributes.action: Make Mental Health First Aid a compulsory element of teacher training.
attributes.background: I'm Ben, I've set up this petition as part of a teenage mental health awareness campaign started after my brother, Sam West, tragically committed suicide aged 15 in January 2018. Your signature won't bring my brother back, but it could save someone else's life and that's all I want.
attributes.additional_details: Some teachers, who will remain anonymous, have reacted positively to the idea when it was put past them stating that teachers often won't act at all as they don't have the knowledge or confidence to deal with the situation. A compulsory course will provide the confidence to at least approach a student about their mental wellbeing and start working on a solution. This vital next move, which is cheaper than alternatives, can combat the ever-escalating problem which is teenage mental health.

attributes.action: Require schools to sell logos to sew on to uniforms
attributes.background: Uniform costs are rising and parents are having to worry about meeting these costs. If schools were made to sell their logos to sew onto cheaper alternatives this would alleviate a massive burden. Instead of paying £50 for a blazer cheaper ones are available at a fraction of the cost etc.

attributes.action: Require unused holiday pay to be paid to employees at end of every year service.
attributes.background: Many employees lose out of their full holiday pay mostly due to unable to take them depending on their job role. Employers are entitled to 5.6 weeks holiday a year. Sometimes requests get rejected by employers or can't use them all. All unused holiday play should be paid at end of the holiday year.
attributes.additional_details: I've requested holidays to be used in quiet periods and most the time I don't get them and end up losing atleast half my holiday pay aswell as many others. What's the point in entitling employees 5.6 weeks a year but they don't get the full holidays they are entitled to. These unused holidays should be paid to employees at the end of every working year as its unfair if the employer does not usage them and in turn we lose out on what we are entitled to every year.  Scrap the "don't use you lose"

attributes.action: Make a mandatory minimum sentence for child sex offenders
attributes.background:
To many sex offenders get let of with community punishment orders ect I think there should be more of a deterrent and a mandatory minimum prison sentence. 
Also the public especially those with children should have acces to view if any registered sex offenders live in the area they reside.

attributes.action: Lower the percentage for child maintenance deductions from earnings
attributes.background: The current cms payment scheme for non resident parents has a massive impact on non resident working people that are paying rent and bills for their current living situation. A drop in pay or overtime no less than 25 % will leave you with nothing to pay rent and bills.
attributes.additional_details: Non resident fathers will be left in financial difficulty with the cms payment scheme and would be forced to leave work this is not good for the kids that need money.

attributes.action: UK to cut ties and impose sanctions on Pakistan until they rerun elections
attributes.background: It has been reported that the recent Pakistani elections were one of the dirtiest and most rigged elections in many years. The media reports that Pakistan Muslim League-Nawaz was the main target of election irregularities and rigging across the country.
attributes.additional_details: According to the media, Pakistan Army soldiers were present inside every polling station at the end of the polling before the polling count started they intervened and forced every polling agent to leave the polling premises. Political parties in Pakistan have rejected these rigged polls. Pakistan's Election Commission should conduct free and fair elections.

attributes.action: Require companies to tell applicants the status of their job application.
attributes.background: Applicants should have a right to receive a reply from employers. This petition isn’t to push for critical feedback, but a simple “yes, you have a job” or “no, you haven’t." Failure to reply within a reasonable time-frame should be punished by fines, depending on the company's size.
attributes.additional_details:
A simple reply from an employer can help better a person's options. People seeking work explore and apply for various types of employment, unskilled jobs, career and training programs or apprenticeships; and often, many of these jobs would start around the same time. Some options may be better than others depending on the individual, and a simple reply of “yes”, “no” or “still being reviewed” can improve a person on making a better choice financially or for their lifestyle.

Placing an applicant in a state of suspense and stress, sometimes for months when it comes to programs and apprenticeships is a cruel situation to place anyone in, when a feedback about the application will allow an applicant to move on and accept other options.
